results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Birds)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are six parts to the bird slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.

results.title: House in summer magic lantern slide
results.brief_description: Magic lantern slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a English style house and gardens. Several pencil marking on the wood. On the underside, ‘57’ has been written in a thick white ink.

results.title: Hand painted strip slide magic lantern with chimney
results.brief_description:
Hand painted strip slide magic lantern projector with chimney, and one set of hand painted glass slides (in restored condition).
Strip slide is a single sheet of glass with hand painting directly on to glass. Slide has a wooden frame (stable condition)
1 x Box containing projector
1 x Package containing glass slide (VERY FRAGILE)

results.title: Child's toy tin magic lantern with candle projection
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description:
Magic Lantern with removable chimney and internal wooden block.

The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit was donated by Edwin Schefferle - “When Edwin was about 10 years of age, he acquired a Magic Lantern Outfit from his Grandma. This fired his imagination; he would make images with ink on strips of cellophane and project these through the Magic Lantern by means of a candle onto an old sheet draped on the wall. The result was disappointing but encouraging. The one candle did not provide sufficient light especially during daylight. Little did he realise that he had opened a door on a world of projecting images on large screens. He had abandoned merry-go-rounds and wind mills but this was different. He never let go of his Magic Lantern; it could well have been dubbed his lighthouse showing him the way to go. What happened to his Magic Lantern? After his death in 2014 it was found among his belongings and was donated to the Australian Centre for Moving Image (ACMI) which superseded the State Film Centre, where Edwin spent most of his working life.” (text from book - ‘Life with a Purpose, Conversations with Edwin James Schefferle - Scheff’)
results.title_for_label: Child’s toy tin magic lantern with candle projection
results.description:
Magic Lantern with removable chimney and internal wooden block.

The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit was donated by Edwin Schefferle - “When Edwin was about 10 years of age, he acquired a Magic Lantern Outfit from his Grandma. This fired his imagination; he would make images with ink on strips of cellophane and project these through the Magic Lantern by means of a candle onto an old sheet draped on the wall. The result was disappointing but encouraging. The one candle did not provide sufficient light especially during daylight. Little did he realise that he had opened a door on a world of projecting images on large screens. He had abandoned merry-go-rounds and wind mills but this was different. He never let go of his Magic Lantern; it could well have been dubbed his lighthouse showing him the way to go. What happened to his Magic Lantern? After his death in 2014 it was found among his belongings and was donated to the Australian Centre for Moving Image (ACMI) which superseded the State Film Centre, where Edwin spent most of his working life.” (text from book - ‘Life with a Purpose, Conversations with Edwin James Schefferle - Scheff’)

The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit was donated by Edwin Schefferle - “When Edwin was about 10 years of age, he acquired a Magic Lantern Outfit from his Grandma. This fired his imagination; he would make images with ink on strips of cellophane and project these through the Magic Lantern by means of a candle onto an old sheet draped on the wall. The result was disappointing but encouraging. The one candle did not provide sufficient light especially during daylight. Little did he realise that he had opened a door on a world of projecting images on large screens. He had abandoned merry-go-rounds and wind mills but this was different. He never let go of his Magic Lantern; it could well have been dubbed his lighthouse showing him the way to go. What happened to his Magic Lantern? After his death in 2014 it was found among his belongings and was donated to the Australian Centre for Moving Image (ACMI) which superseded the State Film Centre, where Edwin spent most of his working life.” (text from book - ‘Life with a Purpose, Conversations with Edwin James Schefferle - Scheff’)

results.title: Glass slide magic lantern
results.brief_description:
Glass slide projector as used by Department of Agriculture, Melbourne.
Lens can be compacted or extended, see attached images from ICS.
Modifications include addition of electricity and edision bulb.
1 Box containing 2 parts.

results.title: Magic lantern set effects slide (Man and lions)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a man fights between two lions set against a black background. Made by Lawler, 161 Strand, London. ‘91’ written in pencil on wooden frame. Cream tape has been adhered to the edge of the sliding section.

results.title: Magic lantern slipping slide (Knight and Princess)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with dark wooden frame. By sliding the effects slide, a a princess pushes a knight from her window or cuts his climbing rope, resulting in his fall Set against a black background.

results.title: Magic lantern three-panel slipping slide (Flower Bloom)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming. Two adjustable sliding pieces of glass - slide left and right to show the flower blooming. Set against a black background. Made by W.F. Archer, Liverpool, 43 Lord St and 63 South Castle St. ‘49’ and ‘R’ written in pencil on wooden frame.
results.description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming. results.title: Man and Donkey lever magic lantern slide
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a portrait of a man wearing a hat in a circular slide. An adjustable handle allows the viewer to move a beard.
